attribute.name: weight

level.language: My product should be exceedingly light and should weigh next to nothing or be light as air.
0 or Light as air
icon-weight-0
weight||Weight||You like things that are very light and weigh next to nothing or light as air!||icon-weight-0
My product should weigh no more than 5 pounds because I am going to carry it in my arms or tote it around in my backpack for long enough to be a problem if it weighs more.
5 Pounds
icon-weight-5
weight||Weight||The maximum weight you will tolerate carrying for any length of time is 5 pounds - and even that is a stretch!||icon-weight-5
My product can weigh up to 10 pounds because I am going to carry it in my backpack or in my carry on luggage so I will not be directly stressed by the weight.
10 Pounds
icon-weight-10
weight||Weight||You're ok with a maximum weight of 10 pounds because you have no intention of carrying this around, except in a backpack or in carry on luggage.||icon-weight-10
My product can weigh 15 pounds or more because I am never going to be carrying it. It will sit on my desk either at work or home.
15 Pounds
icon-weight-15
weight||Weight||You're ok with a maximum weight of 15 pounds or more because you have not intention of every picking it up.||icon-weight-15

attribute.language: Weight is the standard or established amount that a thing should weigh. The first known word usage was in 1647.
How much should your product weigh?
Shift the sliders to indicate GREATER or LESSER importance for the weights shown.
weight||You're ok with a maximum weight of 15 pounds or more because you have not intention of every picking it up.||icon-weight-15

attribute.name: shape

level.language: A circle is a closed plane curve and every point is equidistant from a fixed point within the curve. The first know word usage was in the 14th century.
My product will be in the shape of a Circle
icon-shape-circle
Shape||Shape||You love things that are perfectly round and are in the shape of a circle, like coins.||icon-shape-circle
A square is defined as having four equal sides and four right angles. The first known word usage was in the 14th century.
My product will be in the shape of a Square
icon-shape-square
Shape||Shape||You love things that are perfectly square, like a Rubik's cube!||icon-shape-square

A triangle is a geometric figure with three sides and three angles. Each two sides meet at a point called a vertex, and the three angles sum to 180°. A triangle with one 90° (right) angle is a right triangle. A triangle with all sides (and thus all angles) equal is equilateral, one with two sides equal is isosceles, and one with no two sides equal is scalene. The first know word usage was in the 14th century.
My product will be in the shape of a Triangle
icon-shape-triangle
Shape||Shape||You love things that are in the shape of a triangle, well, like a triangle in music.||icon-shape-triangle
A rectangle is defined as a parallelogram whose angles are all right angles and whose adjacent sides are of unequal length. The first know word usage was in 1571.
My product will be in the shape of a Rectangle
icon-shape-rectangle
Shape||Shape||You love things that are in the shape of a rectangle, like a credit card.||icon-shape-rectangle

attribute.language: Horizontal / Vertical Scales that are typical throughout the platform.
shape||You love things that are in the shape of a rectangle, like a credit card.||icon-shape-rectangle

Use the controls to indicate your minimum and maximum prices. The minimum is the least amount you want to pay while the maximum is the most amount you want to pay.

This question is asking you to select the expected value multiple that is optimal for you. Click on the single right arrow to incrementally increase the value multiple. Click on the single left arrow to incrementally decrease the value multiple. Clicking on the double right arrow will jump to the highest value multiple of $200. Clicking on the double left arrow will jump to the lowest value multiple of $0.

resource.name: onboardintrowithintropopup
resource.language: Your company has developed this tool to further understand your dealership needs and preferences and how to better meet them. It will take just a few minutes to share your perspectives. Afterwards, you will be presented with a summary of your feedback and how it compares to your peers.
The core part of this tool is divided into three sections:
Feature Preferences – rate the importance of value-added business and operational sub-factors
Importance of Preference – rate the relative importance of broader categories of business and operational value-added
Tradeoffs – refine your feedback by indicating preferences between paired options
Survey – answer questions about your satisfaction across broader categories of business.
We are going to go over what we will be doing in the application.
This exercise should not take you more than 10 mins. Thank you for your input and continued partnership!

NOTE - Additional information is available for each option by clicking on or tapping the icons.
The information included may help further explain the option.

resource.name: onboardintro2
resource.language: TrueChoice Solutions has developed this tool to further understand your needs and preferences and how to better meet them. See below to understand how the survey works before you begin.
The survey tool is divided into three main sections:
Important Tip! Click on the symbol for more info. You'll see it on every page, at the top of the section and on the icons. Just click to learn more whenever you have a question.
1. Feature Preferences – First, we'll look at categories one by one. We'll show you a few different options and ask that you move the slider bar to tell us how you feel in a "more or less" way.
2. Importance of Preference – Second, we'll show you options grouped together and ask you to rate which are most and least important to you.
3. Tradeoffs – Third, we'll use the info from your choices in the first two sections to create pairs of hypothetical packages. We'll ask you to choose which of the two options you prefer most.
Thank you for your input! Understanding your priorities is an important part of making TrueChoice Solutions a great place to work.

resource.name: levelScale
resource.language: These are scales that record inputs in an unordered manner.

Moving a slider UP means the option is MORE important. Moving a slider DOWN means the option is LESS important. The sliders have been pre-set in order of generally accepted preferences. Therefore, you cannot move a slider above the one to its right or lower than the one to its left.
If this characteristic is irrelevant to you, click Next and you will not be asked about it again.

These questions ask you to state your preferences among several features. Please indicate how much you like each choice in relation to the other options by sliding the icons up (increased preference) and down (decreased preference). You may not have the same preference for all choices.
Why am I being asked this question in this way?
We do not just want to know what you most prefer. We want to understand your preferences for all of the hypothetical options between the two extremes.

resource.name: implicitDescendingScale
resource.language: These are scales that record inputs in an unordered manner.

If this characteristic is irrelevant to you, click Next and you will not be asked about it again.

resource.name: attributeScale
resource.language: Rate the relative importance of the following attributes.
For each attribute below, indicate its importance relative to the others by clicking or tapping within the circle. A value of 1 is less important while a value of 100 is more important.

On the left side of the screen is a list of the features that we asked you about in Stage 1. As you respond to each feature, your most and least preferred choices will appear to the right to remind you of your earlier responses.
For each feature, you're asked to indicate how important each is to you, from a scale of least important (1) to most important (100). Your responses here establish the set of trade-offs that you will be asked in the final stage, so please take care in moving the sliders to the left (less important features) and to the right (more important features).

resource.name: tradeoffScale
resource.language: Assume all your choices are identical in every way except for the features shown. Based on the strength of your preference, slide towards the combination you prefer.

These questions show several different feature combinations. Assuming your overall choices are identical in every way except for the features shown, please choose the combination you prefer and rate how strongly you prefer that option.
For example, if you were to select a value of 10 for the combination on the right-hand side, it would tell the system that you strongly prefer this combination over the option on the left-hand side. Leaving the value at 0 would mean you don't prefer one over the other.

resource.name: directorUid
resource.language:
Please enter your Survey Access Code
(Please note - this screen is not yet finalized)

Where do I get my survey access code?

1. Your Restaurant Manager has your unique code.
2. If not, call the McDonald's help line at 1-800-555-5555.

Why do you need this?

Your survey access code is used for access to the survey.
Survey access codes are unique.
Survey responses are anonymous and strictly confidential.
Please verify that your 8 digit survey access code is correct and try again.

profile-key.language: User Transparency

TrueChoice Solutions, Inc. is a data analytics company that will collect your product and service preferences data. This will help BrandCo develop future product and service strategies that benefit your business.
Tooltip in label-display
Do you consent to this?
Tooltip from checkbox widget

<b>TrueChoice Solutions, Inc. will share your data with BrandCo for the duration of this 2 month project. We will collect product and service preferences and customer satisfaction information. We will analyze the data in the United States.<b>
Tooltip in label-display
Do you consent to this?
To learn more about how TrueChoice Solutions, Inc. will manage your data and about your data privacy rights, click or tap here.

BrandCo will control the data collected from you by TrueChoice Solutions, Inc. BrandCo's contact information is:

Phone: +1 (212) 555-0300 ext. 4545
E-mail: privacy@email.com
www.BrandCo.com
